00020 /// @file  apt-calvin-equivalent.cpp
00021 /// @brief Simple program to check that two Calvin files are equivalent.
00022 
00023 //
00024 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/Calvin.h"
00025 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00026 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00027 #include "util/Convert.h"
00028 #include "util/Err.h"
00029 #include "util/Fs.h"
00030 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00031 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00032 //
00033 #include <cstring>
00034 #include <map>
00035 #include <string>
00036 #include <vector>

00038 using namespace std;
00039 
00040 
00041 void define_aptcalvinEquiv_options(PgOptions* opts)
00042 {
00043   opts->setUsage("apt-calvin-equivalent - check to see if two Calvin files contain equivalent values.\n\n"
00044                  "This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in \n"
00045                  "precision and compiler rounding errors can lead to representational \n"
00046                  "differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 0.99999981).\n\n"
00047                  "usage:\n"
00048                  "   apt-calvin-equivalent -epsilon 0.001 -fraction 0.0001 -c 0.9999 file1.cychp file2.cychp");
00049                  
00050   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00051                      "This message.",
00052                      "false");
00053   opts->defineOption("k", "check-header", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00054                      "Check header parameters and values match.",
00055                      "true");
00056   opts->defineOption("i", "ignore-params-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00057                      "Path to TSV file with list of header parameters, datasets, and \n" 
00058                                          "dataset columns to ignore. (One column with header line IgnoreParameters)",
00059                      "");
00060   opts->defineOption("m", "epsilon-map-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00061                      "Path to TSV file with mapEpsilon parameter threshold values.\n" 
00062                                          "(Two columns with header line MapParameter MapEpsilon)",
00063                      "");
00064   opts->defineOption("l", "message-limit", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00065                      "Maximum number messages to report.",
00066                      "1000");
00067   opts->defineOption("e", "epsilon", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00068                      "Epsilon tolerance to differences.",
00069                      ".001");
00070   opts->defineOption("f", "fraction", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00071                      "Fractional tolerance to differences.",
00072                      "0.0");
00073   opts->defineOption("c", "correlation", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00074                      "Correlation tolerance to differences.",
00075                      "1.0");
00076   opts->defineOption("v", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00077                      "Display version information.",
00078                      "false");
00079   opts->defineOption("n", "report-nan-num-diff", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00080                      "Report differences between NaN and non-NaN values.",
00081                      "false");
00082 }
00083 
00084 /**
00085  * Check data in all sections of binary Calvin file to determine eqivalence.
00086  *
00087  * @param opts - Options supplied to program.
00088  * @return status 0 if equivalent, non-zero if not not equivalent.
00089  */
00090 int calvinEquiv(PgOptions *opts) {
00091   float fEpsilon = (float) opts->getDouble("epsilon");
00092   float fFraction = (float) opts->getDouble("fraction");
00093   double dCorrelationCutoff = opts->getDouble("correlation");
00094   bool bCheckHeader = opts->getBool("check-header");
00095   int iMessageLimit = opts->getInt("message-limit");
00096   bool bFlagNaNNumDiff = opts->getBool("report-nan-num-diff");
00097   std::string setIgnoreFile = opts->get("ignore-params-file");
00098   std::string mapEpsilonFile = opts->get("epsilon-map-file");
00099   if(opts->getArgCount() != 2) {
00100     Err::errAbort("Must have exactly two file name arguments.");
00101   }
00102   Verbose::setLevel(2);
00103   // load list if parameters to ignore from text file
00104   std::set<std::string> setIgnore;
00105   if(setIgnoreFile!="") {
00106     std::vector<std::string> vectorIgnore;
00107     affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(setIgnoreFile,"IgnoreParameters",&vectorIgnore);
00108     // copy vector to set required by interface
00109     vector <std::string>::iterator vectorIgnore_Iter = vectorIgnore.begin();
00110     for( vectorIgnore_Iter=vectorIgnore.begin() ; vectorIgnore_Iter!=vectorIgnore.end() ; vectorIgnore_Iter++ ) {
00111       setIgnore.insert(*vectorIgnore_Iter);
00112         }
00113     Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(setIgnore.size()) + " ignored parameters from: " + Fs::basename(setIgnoreFile));
00114   }
00115   std::map<std::string, float> mapEpsilon;
00116   // load mapping of parameter names to epsilon values from text file
00117   if(mapEpsilonFile!="") {
00118     std::vector<std::string> vectorMapParameter;
00119     std::vector<std::string> vectorMapEpsilon;
00120     affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(mapEpsilonFile,"MapParameter",&vectorMapParameter);
00121     affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(mapEpsilonFile,"MapEpsilon",&vectorMapEpsilon);
00122     // copy vector to set required by interface
00123         vector <std::string>::iterator vectorMapEpsilon_Iter = vectorMapEpsilon.begin();
00124     for( vector <std::string>::iterator vectorMapParameter_Iter = vectorMapParameter.begin() ; 
00125                  vectorMapParameter_Iter != vectorMapParameter.end() ; 
00126                  vectorMapParameter_Iter++ ) {
00127       bool success;
00128       double dMapEpsilon = Convert::toDoubleCheck(*vectorMapEpsilon_Iter, &success);
00129           if(success) {
00130         mapEpsilon[*vectorMapParameter_Iter] = (float)dMapEpsilon;
00131           }
00132           else {
00133         Err::errAbort("Could not convert MapEpsilon value '" + *vectorMapEpsilon_Iter + "' to numeric value for parameter '" + *vectorMapParameter_Iter + "'.");            
00134           }
00135           vectorMapEpsilon_Iter++;
00136         }
00137     Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(mapEpsilon.size()) + " MapEpsilon parameter value pairs from: " + Fs::basename(mapEpsilonFile));
00138   }
00139   // compare Calvin files
00140   const bool ok = Calvin::equivalent(opts->getArg(0), opts->getArg(1), setIgnore, setIgnore, mapEpsilon, fEpsilon, dCorrelationCutoff,bCheckHeader, iMessageLimit, fFraction, bFlagNaNNumDiff);
00141   // A return of 0 is good, 1 is bad.
00142   return ! ok;
00143 }
00144 
00145 /** Everybody's favorite function. */
00146 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
00147   try {
00148   const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00149 
00150   int same = 0;
00151 
00152   PgOptions *opts = NULL;
00153   opts = new PgOptions();
00154   define_aptcalvinEquiv_options(opts);
00155   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00156 
00157   // Do we need help?
00158   if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00159     opts->usage();
00160     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00161   }
00162   else if(opts->getBool("version")) {
00163     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00164   }
00165   else {
00166     same = calvinEquiv(opts);
00167   }
00168   delete opts;
00169   return same;
00170   } 
00171   catch(...) {
00172     Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00173     return 1;
00174   }
00175 }
